channel.title: Oracle suing Google over Android Java use
channel.description:
http://www.pcmag.com/article2/0,2817,2367761,00.asp
The Android operating system uses Java both in its software development kit and a Java-like virtual machine, called Dalvik, in the runtime environment. It is both the SDK and Dalvik that Sun targeted with its suit, claiming that they infringed Sun's patents. Sun also claims that Google has infringed its trademarks, including code and documentation.
i hope google doesn't lose..

item.title: Oracle suing Google over Android Java use

sun is open-source …

how will they win now, if they made it open-source?

item.title: Oracle suing Google over Android Java use
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

xEnt:

oracle givin my javas a bad name

Sun would have never let this fly.

This is definitely the way to promote your product isn’t it? Sue the people who use it? Seems like a bad idea to me.

Besides, isn’t java 7 going completely open source in the near future? Google may even be using those libraries, so what complaint does Oracle have again?

item.title: Oracle suing Google over Android Java use
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

PCMAG

Oracle Sues Google Over Android Java Use

Oracle said Thursday that it has sued Google for patent and copyright infringement over the use of Java in the Android operating system. The reason is Android's use of the Dalvik virtual machine.

The Android operating system uses Java both in its software development kit and a Java-like virtual machine, called Dalvik, in the runtime environment. It is both the SDK and Dalvik that Sun targeted with its suit, claiming that they infringed Sun's patents. Sun also claims that Google has infringed its trademarks, including code and documentation.

i hope google doesn’t lose…

Read full topic
item.source: Oracle suing Google over Android Java use
